  materials.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.34%;">
  <p style="line-height:10.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Wingdings" style="font-size:9.5pt;">o</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="95%" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:95.66%;">
  <p style="line-height:10.3pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Check box if any part of the fee is offset
  as provided by Exchange Act Rule&nbsp;0-11(a)(2)&nbsp;and identify the filing
  for which the offsetting fee was paid previously. Identify the previous
  filing by registration statement number, or the Form&nbsp;or Schedule and the
  date of its filing.</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.34%;">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 15.5pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="326" height="133" src="g63501bei001.gif" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">NOTICE OF 2007 ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
OF THE AES CORPORATION<br>
TO BE HELD ON MONDAY, JUNE 25, 2007<a name="NoticeOf2007AnnualMeetingOfStockh_024656"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">May&nbsp;25, 2007</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">TO THE HOLDERS OF COMMON STOCK OF THE AES CORPORATION:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The 2007 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of The AES Corporation will be
held on Monday, June&nbsp;25, 2007, at 9:30&nbsp;a.m. in the Rotunda Conference
Room&nbsp;on the 9</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">th</font>&#160;floor of the
Company&#146;s corporate offices located at 4300 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington,
Virginia. Doors to the Annual Meeting will open at 8:30&nbsp;a.m.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">At the Annual Meeting, stockholders will vote
on the following matters:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The election of 10
members to the Board of Directors;</p>

<p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The ratification
of Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Touche LLP as the independent auditors of the Company
for the year 2007; and</p>

<p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Such other
business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Stockholders of record at the close of
business on April&nbsp;27, 2007 are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the
Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="border-collapse:collapse;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="55%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:55.24%;">

  </td>
  <td width="42%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:42.12%;">

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">

  </td>

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="55%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:55.24%;">

  </td>
  <td width="42%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:42.12%;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">and Secretary</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 24.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">EACH STOCKHOLDER IS REQUESTED TO EXECUTE AND
PROMPTLY RETURN THE ENCLOSED PROXY CARD. A PREPAID ENVELOPE IS ENCLOSED FOR
RETURNING PROXY CARDS. ALTERNATIVELY, STOCKHOLDERS MAY&nbsp;VOTE BY TELEPHONE
OR VIA THE INTERNET (SEE DIRECTIONS ON THE ENCLOSED PROXY CARD). ANY
STOCKHOLDER SUBMITTING A PROXY CARD HAS THE POWER TO REVOKE THE VOTE SET FORTH
IN SUCH PROXY CARD AT ANY TIME PRIOR TO THE SUBMISSION OF VOTES AT THE ANNUAL
MEETING. STOCKHOLDERS WHO ARE PRESENT AT THE ANNUAL MEETING MAY&nbsp;WITHDRAW
THEIR PROXY AND VOTE IN PERSON. TO ENSURE THAT YOUR VOTE WILL BE COUNTED,
PLEASE CAST YOUR VOTE BEFORE MIDNIGHT (EDT) ON JUNE 24, 2007.</font></b></p>

</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:.38%;">
  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="94%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:94.58%;">
  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt 9.5pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-9.5pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;"><a href="#Proposal2RatificationOfTheAppoint_040350" title="Click to goto ">PROPOSAL 2:
  RATIFICATION OF THE APPOINTMENT OF AUDITORS</a></font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:2.64%;">
  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">53</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:.38%;">
  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="94%" valign="top" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:94.58%;">

  FINANCIAL AUDIT COMMITTEE</a></font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:2.64%;">
  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">54</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:.38%;">

  REGARDING THE INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM&#146;S FEES,

  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:2.64%;">

  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">56</font></p>

  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:2.42%;">
  <p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:5.0pt 0in .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">57</font></p>

  THE ANNUAL MEETING</a></font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="0%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0in .7pt 0in 0in;width:.38%;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0in 0in 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="margin:.25in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">2</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\Fc\14153259855_P66533CHE_2137229\6350-1-bg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 05:33 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="background:#EBEBEB;border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="100%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:3.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableFull --><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading --><font size="3" style="font-size:12.0pt;">PROXY STATEMENT<a name="ProxyStatement_035330"></a></font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">May&nbsp;25,
2007</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
accompanying Proxy is solicited by the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) of The
AES Corporation (the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;AES&#148;). The Proxy is solicited for use at the
2007 Annual Meeting of Stockholders of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Annual
Meeting will commence at 9:30&nbsp;a.m. on Monday, June&nbsp;25, 2007. The
Annual Meeting will be held in the 9</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">th</font>&#160;floor Rotunda Conference Room&nbsp;of the
Company&#146;s corporate offices located at 4300 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington,
Virginia. Any adjournment of the Annual Meeting will be held at the same
address. Directions to the Annual Meeting are located on page&nbsp;62 of this
Proxy Statement.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">This Proxy
Statement provides information regarding the matters to be voted on at the
Annual Meeting as well as other information that may be useful to you. Our
Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 also is enclosed with this Proxy Statement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">This Proxy
Statement and accompanying Proxy Card are first being sent to stockholders on
or about May&nbsp;25, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Questions And Answers Regarding The Proxy
Statement And Annual Meeting<a name="QuestionsAndAnswersRegardingThePr_030124"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">WHAT IS THE RECORD DATE?<a name="WhatIsTheRecordDate_030125"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The record date
is established by the Board as required by Delaware law. Owners of record of
our common stock at the close of business on the record date are entitled to
receive notice of the Annual Meeting. Such owners of record are also entitled
to vote at the Annual Meeting and any adjournments of the Annual Meeting. Each
share of common stock is entitled to one vote. The record date for the Annual
Meeting is April 27, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">HOW DOES A STOCKHOLDER SUBMIT A VOTE ON A
PROPOSAL?<a name="HowDoesAStockholderSubmitAVoteOnA_030129"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">A stockholder
may vote by marking, signing, dating and returning the enclosed Proxy Card in
the enclosed prepaid envelope. Alternatively, a stockholder may vote by
telephone, via the Internet, or in person by attending the Annual Meeting. Only
stockholders registered on the books of our transfer agent may vote in person
at the Annual Meeting. Instructions on how to vote by phone or via the Internet
are set forth on the enclosed Proxy Card. If a stockholder owns shares through
a broker or other intermediary, voting instructions are set forth on the
enclosed voting instruction card.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">If a Proxy is
properly executed, the shares it represents will be voted at the Annual Meeting
in accordance with the instructions noted on the Proxy. If no instructions are
specified in the Proxy with respect to the matters to be acted upon, the shares
represented by the Proxy will be voted in accordance with the recommendations
of the Board. The recommendations of the Board regarding the matters to be
acted upon at the Annual Meeting are set forth in this Proxy Statement. Proxies
marked as abstentions, or to withhold a vote from a Nominee as in the case of
Proposal 1 for election of Directors, will have the effect of a negative vote.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\Fc\14153716841_P66533CHE_2137229\6350-1-ca.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 05:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">MAY&nbsp;A STOCKHOLDER CHANGE A VOTE?<a name="MayaStockholderChangeAVote_030132"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Stockholders
are entitled to revoke their proxies at any time before their shares are voted
at the Annual Meeting. To revoke a Proxy, a stockholder must file&nbsp;a
written notice of revocation with the Company, or deliver a duly executed Proxy
bearing a later date than the original submitted Proxy, or attend the Annual
Meeting and vote in person.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">HOW MANY SHARES OF STOCK WERE OUTSTANDING ON
THE RECORD DATE?<a name="HowManySharesOfStockWereOutstandi_030136"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">At the close of
business on April&nbsp;27, 2007, there were 667,542,916 shares of common stock
outstanding. Each share of common stock is entitled to one vote.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">WHAT IS A BROKER NON-VOTE?<a name="WhatIsABrokerNonvote_030137"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">A beneficial
owner is a stockholder who has engaged a nominee, such as a broker, to hold
shares for or on behalf of the beneficial owner. A broker non-vote occurs when
a nominee submits a Proxy but has not received voting instructions from the
beneficial owner with respect to a particular matter and the nominee does not
possess or choose to exercise his/her discretionary authority to vote the
shares for the particular matter. A broker non-vote will be considered as
present at the Annual Meeting for purposes of establishing a quorum. A broker
non-vote will not be counted as present for a vote or as a vote for or against
a proposal.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">WHAT CONSTITUTES A QUORUM?<a name="WhatConstitutesAQuorum_030139"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Under our By-laws,
a quorum is a majority of the outstanding shares of our common stock entitled
to vote. The number of outstanding shares of common stock entitled to vote at
the Annual Meeting is determined as of the record date. Abstentions and broker
non-votes are counted in determining whether a quorum is present for the Annual
Meeting. A copy of the By-laws is available on our website (<u>www.aes.com</u>).</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">ARE VOTING RECORDS CONFIDENTIAL?<a name="AreVotingRecordsConfidential_030142"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">We require vote
tabulators and the inspector of the election to execute agreements to maintain
the confidentiality of voting records. Voting records will remain confidential
except as necessary to meet legal requirements and in other limited
circumstances such as proxy contests.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">HOW DOES THE COMPANY SOLICIT PROXIES?<a name="HowDoesTheCompanySolicitProxies_030143"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Proxies will be
solicited by mail, telephone, or other means of communication. We will bear the
cost of the solicitation of proxies. The Company has retained Computershare
Trust Co., N.A. (&#147;Computershare&#148;) and Corporate Investor Communications,&nbsp;Inc.,
to assist in soliciting proxies from stockholders and we will pay a fee
estimated at $8,000, plus expenses, for such services. In addition,
solicitation may be made by our Directors, officers, and other employees. We
reimburse brokerage firms, custodians, nominees, and fiduciaries in accordance
with the rules&nbsp;of the National Association of Securities Dealers,&nbsp;Inc.
for reasonable expenses incurred by them in forwarding materials to the
beneficial owners of our common stock.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">4</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\Fc\14153716841_P66533CHE_2137229\6350-1-ca.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 05:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="background:#EBEBEB;border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="100%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:3.0pt 0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableFull --><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading --><font size="3" style="font-size:12.0pt;">PROPOSAL 1: ELECTION OF DIRECTORS<a name="Proposal1ElectionOfDirectors_035520"></a></font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Board
submits the names of the 10 persons (&#147;Nominees&#148;) identified and discussed in
the paragraphs below for election to the Board of Directors of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">In 2006, the
Board met eleven (11) times, including six (6) telephonic meetings. In
accordance with the Company&#146;s Corporate Governance Guidelines, non-management
Directors meet after each in-person meeting of the Board. Non-management
Directors met five (5) times in 2006 with Mr. Darman presiding as Lead
Independent Director. All Directors attended at least 80% of all meetings of
the Board and Committees on which they serve. Board members are expected to
attend all meetings of the Board, including the Annual Meeting and meetings of
the Board committees on which they serve. All of the Nominees attended the 2006
Annual Meeting of Stockholders.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Only one of the
Nominees, Paul Hanrahan, is also an employee of the Company. The Board has
determined that each of the Nominees, except Paul Hanrahan, is independent
under existing New York Stock Exchange (&#147;NYSE&#148;) rules&nbsp;and, in the case of
the members of our Financial Audit Committee, also under the independence
standards for audit committee members adopted by the Securities and
Exchange&#160; Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;). In
making this determination, the Board considers not only the criteria for
independence set forth in the listing standards of the NYSE but also any other
relevant facts and circumstances that come to the Board&#146;s attention, after
inquiry, relating to transactions, relationships or arrangements between a
Director or a Nominee or any member of their immediate family (or any entity of
which a Director or Nominee or an immediate family member is an executive
officer, general partner or significant equity holder) and AES or any of its
subsidiaries or affiliates that might signal potential conflicts of interest,
or that might bear on the materiality of a Director&#146;s or a Nominee&#146;s
relationship to AES or any of it&#146;s subsidiaries. The Board considers the issue
not merely from the standpoint of the Director or Nominee, but also from that
of the persons or organizations with which the Director or Nominee is
affiliated.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">A Nominee will
be elected to serve as a Director if a majority of the votes of the shares of common
stock present in person or represented by Proxy at the Annual Meeting, at which
a quorum is present, are voted in favor of the Nominee. Directors are elected
to hold office until the next Annual Meeting of Stockholders and until their
respective successors have been elected and qualified.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Richard Darman,</font></i></b></font><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">  </font></i></b></font><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;">age 64,</font></i></b></font> has been a
Director of AES since July 2002. He served as Vice Chairman from December 2002
until May 2003, and was elected Chairman of the Board on May 1, 2003. In
addition to his service as Chairman, Mr. Darman serves as Lead Independent
Director of the Board. He is a Partner and Managing Director of The Carlyle
Group (&#147;Carlyle&#148;), one of the world&#146;s largest private equity firms. He joined
Carlyle in February 1993, after serving in the cabinet of the first Bush
administration as Director of the U.S. Office of Management and Budget (from
1989 to 1993). Prior to joining the Bush cabinet, he was a Managing Director of
Shearson Lehman Brothers, Deputy Secretary of the U.S. Treasury, and Assistant
to the President of the United States. He graduated with honors from Harvard
College in 1964 and from the Harvard Graduate School of Business Administration
in 1967. He is a Trustee of the publicly traded IXIS Funds and Loomis-Sayles
Funds, Trustee of the Howard Hughes Medical Institute, and is Chairman of the
Board of the Smithsonian National Museum of American History. Mr. Darman chairs
the Finance and Investment Committee of the Board. Mr.&nbsp;Darman also&#160; serves as an <i>ex-officio</i>
member of each other committee of the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Paul Hanrahan,</font></i></b></font><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;"> age 49,</font></i></b></font> has been a
Director of AES since June 2002. At that time he was also appointed President
and Chief Executive Officer. Prior to assuming his current position, Mr. Hanrahan
was the Chief Operating Officer and Executive Vice President of AES where he
was responsible for business development </p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">5</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\Fc\14153716841_P66533CHE_2137229\6350-1-ca.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 05:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">activities and
the operation of multiple electric utilities and generation facilities in
Europe, Asia and Latin America. In addition, Mr. Hanrahan was previously the
President and Chief Executive Officer of AES China Generating Co. Ltd., a
public company formerly listed on NASDAQ. He also managed other AES businesses
in the U.S., Europe and Asia. Prior to joining AES, Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan served as
a line officer on a fast attack nuclear submarine, USS Parche (SSN-683). Mr.
Hanrahan serves on the Board of Directors of Corn Products International,&nbsp;Inc.
He is a graduate of Harvard School of Business and the U.S. Naval Academy.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Kristina M. Johnson,</font></i></b></font><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;"> age 50,</font></i></b></font> has been a
Director of AES since April 2004. Dr. Johnson is the chief academic and
administrative officer of the Edmund T. Pratt, Jr., School of Engineering at
Duke University (&#147;Duke&#148;). She joined Duke in July 1999. Prior to joining Duke, Dr.&nbsp;Johnson
served on the faculty at the University of Colorado at Boulder, from 1985-1999
as a Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering, and as a co-founder
and Director (1993-1997) of the National Science Foundation Engineering
Research Center for Optoelectronic Computing Systems Center. Dr. Johnson
received her BS with distinction, MS and PhD from Stanford University in Electrical
Engineering. She is an expert in liquid crystal electro-optics and has
over forty patents or patents pending in this field. Dr. Johnson currently
serves on the Boards of Directors of Minerals Technologies, Inc., Boston
Scientific, and Nortel Networks. Dr. Johnson serves on the Compensation
Committee and the Environment, Safety and Technology Committee of the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">John A. Koskinen,</font></i></b></font>
age 67, has been a Director of AES since April 2004. Mr. Koskinen is President
of the United States Soccer Foundation, a position he has held since June&nbsp;2004.
Previously, Mr. Koskinen served as Deputy Mayor and City Administrator for the
District of Columbia from 2000 to 2003. From 2001 to 2004, Mr.&nbsp;Koskinen
served as a Director of the U.S. Soccer Foundation and served on the Foundation&#146;s
audit committee. Prior to his election as Deputy Mayor, he occupied several
positions with the U.S. Government, including service from 1994 through 1997 as
Deputy Director for Management, Office of Management and Budget. From 1998 to
2000, he served as Assistant to the President (President Clinton) and Chaired
the President&#146;s Council on Year 2000 Conversion. Prior to his most recent
service with the U.S. Government, in 1973, Mr. Koskinen joined the Palmieri
Company, which specialized in turnaround management, as Vice President and
later served as President and Chief Executive Officer from 1979 through 1993. Mr.
Koskinen graduated with a JD, <i>cum laude</i>,
from Yale University School of Law and a BA, <i>magna
cum laude</i>, in physics from Duke University where he was a member of
Phi Beta Kappa. Mr. Koskinen currently serves on the Board of Directors of
American Capital Strategies. Mr. Koskinen serves on the Financial Audit
Committee and Chairs the Environment, Safety and Technology Committee of the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Philip Lader,</font></i></b></font><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;"> age 61,</font></i></b></font> has been a
Director of AES since April 2001. The former U.S. Ambassador to the Court of
St. James&#146;s, he is Chairman of WPP Group plc, the global advertising and
communications services company which includes J. Walter Thompson, Young &amp;
Rubicam, and Ogilvy &amp; Mather. A lawyer, he is also a Senior Advisor to
Morgan Stanley, a Director of Lloyd&#146;s of London, WPP Group plc, Rusal and
Marathon Oil Corporations, Songbird Estates (Canary Wharf) plc, and a trustee
of the RAND Corporation and the Smithsonian Museum of American History.
Formerly White House Deputy Chief of Staff, Assistant to the President, Deputy
Director of the Office of Management and Budget, and Administrator of the U.S.
Small Business Administration, he also was President of Sea Pines Company,
Executive Vice President of the U.S. holdings of the late Sir James Goldsmith,
and president of universities in South Carolina and Australia. He was educated
at Duke University (BA, Phi Beta Kappa, 1966), the University of Michigan (MA,
1967), Oxford University, and Harvard Law School (JD, 1972). Mr. Lader chairs
the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and also serves on the
Environment, Safety and Technology Committee of the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">John H. McArthur,</font></i></b></font>
age 73, has been a Director of AES since January 1997. He is the retired Dean
of the Harvard Business School, and has been a private business consultant and
active investor in various companies since prior to 1994. He is a member of the
Boards of Directors of BCE Inc., Bell Canada, Bell Canada Enterprises, Cabot </p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">6</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\Fc\14153716841_P66533CHE_2137229\6350-1-ca.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 05:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Corporation,&#160; KOC Holdings, A.S. Istanbul, Reuters Founders
Share Company, London, and Telesat Canada. Mr.&nbsp;McArthur chairs the
Financial Audit Committee and serves on the Finance and Investment Committee of
the Board.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Sandra O. Moose,</font></i></b></font>
age 65, has been a Director of AES since April 2004. Dr. Moose is President of
Strategic Advisory Services and previously was a Senior Vice President of The
Boston Consulting Group (&#147;BCG&#148;). She joined BCG in 1968, was a Director since
1975, and a Senior Vice President through 2003. She managed BCG&#146;s New York
Office from 1988-1998 and was appointed Chair of the East Coast. Dr. Moose
received her PhD and MA in economics from Harvard University and BA <i>summa cum laude</i> in economics from Wheaton College. Dr.&nbsp;Moose
serves on the Boards of Directors of Verizon Communications, Rohm and Haas
Company, the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation and IXIS Advisor Funds and Loomis
Sayles Funds where she is Chairperson of the Board of Trustees. Dr.&nbsp;Moose
serves on the Nominating and Corporate Governance and the Finance and
Investment Committees of the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Philip A. Odeen,</font></i></b></font>
age 71, has been a Director of AES since May 1, 2003. From October&nbsp;2006 to
the present, Mr.&nbsp;Odeen has served as Non-Executive Chairman for Avaya. He
served as Non-Executive Chairman for Reynolds and Reynolds Company from July&nbsp;2004
until October 2006. Mr.&nbsp;Odeen retired as Chairman of TRW Inc. in December 2002.
Prior to joining TRW in 1997, Mr. Odeen was President and Chief Executive
Officer of BDM, which TRW acquired in 1997. From 1978 to 1992, Mr. Odeen was a
Senior Consulting Partner with Coopers&nbsp;&amp; Lybrand and served as Vice
Chairman, management consulting services, from 1991 to 1992. From 1972 to 1978,
he was Vice President of the Wilson Sporting Goods Company. Mr. Odeen has
served in senior positions with the Office of the Secretary of Defense and the
National Security Council staff. Mr. Odeen graduated Phi Beta Kappa with a BA
in government from the University of South Dakota. He was a Fulbright Scholar
to the United Kingdom and earned a master&#146;s degree from the University of
Wisconsin. He is a member of the Boards of Directors of Avaya, Convergys
Corporation, and Northrop Grumman Corporation. Mr.&nbsp;Odeen chairs the
Compensation Committee and also serves on the Finance and Investment Committee
of the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Charles O. Rossotti,</font></i></b></font>
age 66, has been a Director of AES since March 2003. Mr. Rossotti is a Senior
Advisor with the Carlyle Group, one of the world&#146;s largest private equity
firms. From November 1997 until November&nbsp;2002, Mr.&nbsp;Rossotti was the
Commissioner of Internal Revenue at the United States Internal Revenue Service
(&#147;IRS&#148;). Prior to joining the IRS, Mr. Rossotti was a founder of American
Management Systems,&nbsp;Inc., where he held the position of President from
1970-1989, Chief Executive Officer from 1981 to 1993 and Chairman from
1989 to 1997. From 1965 to 1969, he held various positions in the Office of
Systems Analysis within the Office of the Secretary of Defense. Mr. Rossotti
graduated <i>magna cum laude</i> from
Georgetown University and received an MBA with high distinction from Harvard
Business School. Mr.&nbsp;Rossotti serves on the Boards of Directors of Adesso
Systems Corporation, Liquid Engines,&nbsp;Inc., Compusearch Systems,&nbsp;Inc.,
and Merrill Lynch &amp; Co., Inc. Mr.&nbsp;Rossotti serves on the Financial
Audit Committee and the Compensation Committee of the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.6pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Sven Sandstrom,</font></i></b></font>
age 65, has been a Director of AES since October 2002. He is the former
Managing Director of the World Bank, retiring from the Bank in December&nbsp;2001.
He is a member of the Governing Council and Treasurer of the International
Union for the Conservation of Nature (IUCN). He co-chairs the funding
negotiations for the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, TB and Malaria. He chairs the
funding negotiations for the African Development Bank. Mr. Sandstrom serves on
the Financial Audit Committee and the Nominating and Corporate Governance
Committee of the Board.</p>

 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">7</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">
