 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="100%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:3.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableFull --><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading --><font size="3" style="font-size:12.0pt;">REPORT OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE<a name="ReportOfTheCompensationCommittee_035738"></a></font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed the Compensation Discussion
and Analysis with AES&#146;s management and, based on this review and discussion,
recommended to the Board that it be included in AES&#146;s proxy statement and
incorporated by reference into AES&#146;s Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the
year ended December 31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Philip A.
Odeen, Chair<br>
Kristina M. Johnson<br>
Charles O. Rossotti</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">22</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\fc\137182147989_D11624_2132815\6350-1-ch.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 17 18:22 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Information About our Compensation Committee
and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee<a name="InformationAboutOurCompensationCo_060038"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee consists of three (3) members of the Board who are &#147;Non-Employee
Directors&#148; as defined under Rule 16b-3 of the Exchange Act. The members
of the Compensation Committee are Kristina M. Johnson, Philip A. Odeen
(Chairman), and Charles O. Rossotti. The Board has determined that each member
of the Compensation Committee meets the standards of independence established
by the NYSE.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee&#146;s principal responsibility is to design and administer
AES&#146;s executive compensation program in order to attract and retain outstanding
people. The Compensation Committee establishes rates of salary, bonuses, profit
sharing contributions, grants of stock options, restricted stock units,
performance units, retirement and other compensation for our officers and for
such other employees as the Board may designate. The Compensation Committee
also evaluates the performance of our executive officers, including the Chief
Executive Officer.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">At the
commencement of each year, AES&#146;s executive officers prepare a list of their
position specific goals and objectives for the upcoming year which, in the case
of all executive officers (other than our Chief Executive Officer), are
submitted to the Chief Executive Officer for his review and comment. In the
case of our Chief Executive Officer, he submits his goals and objectives for
the upcoming year to the Compensation Committee. In the first quarter of the
following year, the Chief Executive Officer performs an assessment of each
executive officer&#146;s performance against their stated goals and, in the case of
our Chief Executive Officer, our Compensation Committee reviews and assesses
his performance against his stated goals and objectives.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Based on our
Chief Executive Officer&#146;s performance, the Compensation Committee, together
with the non-executive Chairman of the Board, prepares the initial evaluation
and compensation recommendation for the Chief Executive Officer&#146;s compensation,
which the Board considers when it determines his compensation. The Compensation
Committee reviews and discusses initial evaluations submitted by the Chief
Executive Officer on the other named executive officers and then recommends
approval to the Board of their respective compensation arrangements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Additionally,
the Compensation Committee makes recommendations to the Board to modify AES&#146;s
compensation and benefit programs if it believes that such programs are not
consistent with Company compensation goals. Under the Compensation Committee&#146;s Charter,
it may form subcommittees and delegate to such subcommittees such power and
authority as the Compensation Committee deems appropriate in accordance with
the Charter. The Compensation Committee has also delegated to the Chief
Executive Officer, subject to review by the Compensation Committee and the
Board, the power to set compensation for non-executive officers. Under the LTC
Plan, the Compensation Committee is also permitted to delegate its authority,
responsibilities and powers to any person selected by it and has expressly
authorized our Chief Executive Officer to make equity grants to non-executive
officers in compliance with law. In 2006, our Chief Executive Officer made
grants of options to purchase 61,397 shares, in the aggregate, to such
employees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee in conjunction with management regularly retains
independent consultants to assist in the development of the information and
analytical tools necessary for the conduct of the Committee&#146;s business. These
consultants help the committee determine the Peer Group and provide
compensation information about those companies. They also review the
competitiveness of the Program, provide information on emerging compensation
practices, ensure compliance with compensation laws and verify the processes
used to determine the value of our long-term compensation. Towers Perrin is the
principal firm retained by our management for these purposes.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">23</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\Fc\1416509485_P66533CHE_2137260\6350-1-cj.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 06:51 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee has instructed the Executive Vice President of Business
Excellence to provide information to the Committee required for developing
compensation programs and determining executive compensation. The Committee may
meet with the external consultants at any time; the Executive Vice President of
Business Excellence directly interfaces with our external consultants in the
preparation of the background material for the committee. In 2006, Towers
Perrin provided market data that supported the implementation of the AES
Corporation Severance Policy. Towers Perrin met directly with the Committee,
and provided it with benchmark information on the &#147;tally sheets&#148; of the named
executive officers, as well as our overall compensation programs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:9.5pt;letter-spacing:-.1pt;">The compensation of our Directors is established by the </font>Nominating
and Corporate Governance Committee. See &#147;The Committees of the Board &#150; Nominating
and Corporate Governance Committee&#148; on page&nbsp;9 of this proxy statement for
a description of our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee&#146;s processes
and procedures in determining director compensation.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.2pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Summary Compensation Table (2006)<a name="SummaryCompensationTable2006_060041"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:normal;">The following Summary Compensation Table
contains information concerning the compensation we provided in 2006 to Paul T.
Hanrahan, our principal executive officer, Victoria Harker, our principal
financial officer, our next three most highly compensated executive officers
for 2006 and our former principal financial officer who left his executive
position prior to the end of 2006 (collectively, our &#147;named executive officers&#148;).</font></b><a name="SummaryCompensationTable_205437"></a></p>

<div align="center" style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">*&nbsp;&nbsp;Column left
blank intentionally</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">NOTES:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Mr. Sharp served as an Executive Vice President and our
Chief Financial Officer until January 20, 2006. On January&nbsp;23, 2006, Ms. Harker
was appointed as our Chief Financial Officer. After stepping down as Chief
Financial Officer, Mr. Sharp has continued as a part-time employee of AES and
reports to our current Chief Financial Officer. AES determined that Mr. Sharp&#146;s
experience and knowledge would be beneficial during a period of transition.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">The base salary earned by each executive during fiscal
year 2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">These amounts relate to Restricted Stock Units (RSUs)
granted in 2006 and prior years. The values set forth in this column are based
on the amounts recognized for financial statement reporting purposes in 2006
computed in accordance with FAS 123R (disregarding any estimates of forfeitures
related to service-based vesting conditions). A discussion of the relevant
assumptions made in the evaluation may be found in our financial statements,
footnotes to the financial statements, or Management&#146;s Discussion &amp;
Analysis, as appropriate, contained in our Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K
for the year ended December 31, 2006 (&#147;AES&#146;s Form&nbsp;10-K&#148;). </font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">24</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\Fc\1416509485_P66533CHE_2137260\6350-1-cj.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 06:51 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(</font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">These amounts relate to Options granted in 2006 and
prior years. The values set forth in this column are based on the amounts
recognized for financial statement reporting purposes in 2006 computed in
accordance with FAS 123R (disregarding any estimates of forfeitures related to
service-based vesting conditions). A discussion of the relevant assumptions
made in the evaluation may be found in our financial statements, footnotes to
the financial statements, or Management&#146;s Discussion&nbsp;&amp; Analysis, as
appropriate, contained in AES&#146;s Form 10-K. </font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">The value of all non-equity incentive plan
awards earned during the 2006 fiscal year and paid during the first quarter of
2007, which includes awards earned under our Performance Incentive Plan (our
annual incentive plan) and awards earned for the three year performance period
ending December&nbsp;31, 2006 for our cash-based, Performance Units (PUs) granted
under our LTC Plan. The following chart shows the breakdown of awards under
these two plans for each executive.</font></p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">We do not have a defined-benefit pension plan. Although
our executives are eligible to participate in nonqualified deferred
compensation plans, we do not provide any above-market and/or preferential earnings
on deferred compensation. Therefore, no amounts are reportable in this Column.
Aggregate earnings on deferred compensation are reported in the Nonqualified
Deferred Compensation Table on page&nbsp;34 of this proxy statement.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:8.0pt;">We provide certain other forms of compensation
including an automobile and driver perquisite for Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan and Company
contributions to qualified and nonqualified defined contribution retirement
plans. The annual automobile and driver perquisite provided to Mr. Hanrahan had
a value of $14,035 in fiscal year 2006, based on our incremental cost to
provide the automobile. &#160;Mr. Hanrahan has
the use of a corporate, leased car and a driver. The incremental cost to
Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&#146;s personal use of the automobile and driver is calculated as
a portion of the cost of the annual lease and drive attributable to his
personal use. The following chart shows the value of our contributions to
qualified and nonqualified defined contribution plans for each executive.</font></p>

<div align="center">

  <p style="line-height:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.75pt;">
  <p style="line-height:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="line-height:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="42" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:31.5pt;">
  <p style="line-height:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">94,117</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="33" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.75pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="line-height:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">25</font></p>

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Grants of Plan-Based Awards (2006)<a name="GrantOfPlanbasedAwards2006_225630"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 8.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The following table contains information
concerning each grant of an award we made under our plans in 2006 to the named
executive officers</font></p>

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.5pt;">

  <td width="40" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:30.0pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">750,000</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.5pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="43" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:32.2pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.5pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.75pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.5pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.7pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="28" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.75pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.7pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.5pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.7pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.5pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:8.7pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.5pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.4pt;">
  <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.25pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.4pt;">

  </td>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">*&nbsp;&nbsp;Column left
blank intentionally</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">NOTES:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Each named executive officer (other than Mr. Sharp)
received two types of non-equity incentive plan awards in 2006: awards under
the Performance Incentive Plan (our annual incentive plan) and Performance
Units (PUs) awarded under our LTC Plan. The first row of data for each named
executive officer shows the threshold, target and maximum award under the
Performance Incentive Plan and the second row shows the threshold, target and
maximum award under the awarded PUs.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">For the Performance Incentive
Plan, the threshold award is 50% of the target award, and the maximum award is
200% of the target award. The extent to which awards are payable depends upon
AES&#146; performance against goals established in the first quarter of the fiscal
year. This award was paid in the first quarter of 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">For the PUs granted under
our LTC Plan, the threshold, target and maximum amounts represent the number of
units multiplied by their value of $1.00. The threshold number is 50% of the
target number of units and the maximum number is 200% of the target number of
units.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Each named executive officer (other than Mr. Sharp)
received Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) which vest based on two conditions, one
of which is performance-based and another which is time-based. The
performance-based condition is based on our total stockholder return as
compared to the cumulative total return of the S&amp;P 500 for the three year
period ending December 31, 2008 (as more fully described in the &#147;Narrative
Disclosure Relating to the Summary Compensation Table and the Grants of
Plan-Based Awards Table&#148;). Assuming this condition is met, the RSUs vest in
three equal annual installments beginning one year from grant. There is no
opportunity to earn more than the RSUs granted on February&nbsp;24, 2006. If
the performance-based condition is not achieved, all shares will be forfeited
effective December 31, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Upon vesting, settlement of
RSUs is automatically deferred for a two-year period.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">The grant date fair value amounts are calculated in
accordance with FAS 123R for the Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) and Options
awarded in 2006 (disregarding any estimates of forfeitures related to
service-based vesting conditions). A discussion of the relevant assumptions
made in the valuations may be found in our financial statements, footnotes to
the financial statements, or Management&#146;s Discussion &amp;Analysis, as
appropriate, contained in AES&#146;s Form 10-K.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">26</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='26',FILE='C:\fc\137182228618_D11624_2132815\6350-1-cl.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 17 18:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Narrative Disclosure Relating to the Summary
Compensation Table and the Grants of Plan-Based Awards&nbsp;Table<a name="NarrativeDisclosureRelatingToTheS_040100"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Employment Agreements<a name="EmploymentAgreements_225534"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">We have
individual employment agreements with Mr. Hanrahan and Ms. Harker (the &#147;Employment
Agreements&#148;). The amount set forth for each of these executives in the &#147;Salary&#148;
column of the Summary Compensation Table was paid to him or her under the terms
of his or her Employment Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Each of the
Employment Agreements are scheduled to expire on December 31, 2007, but will
automatically renew for an additional one year period on January 1, 2008 and on
each subsequent January 1, unless either we or the executive gives a notice of
non-renewal at least six (6) months prior to the renewal date. Each of the
Employment Agreements provides the executive with a base salary that may be
increased, but not decreased. In 2006, the base salary for Mr. Hanrahan was
$903,000 and the base salary for Ms. Harker was $500,000. Under the terms of
the Employment Agreements, Mr. Hanrahan also is eligible for an annual bonus
with a target of 150% of his base salary and Ms. Harker is eligible for an
annual bonus with a target of 80% of her base salary. The annual bonus amounts
are to be paid based on achievement of corporate performance goals and/or other
conditions that are established by the Compensation Committee and which are
generally applicable to other senior executive officers. The Employment
Agreements also provide each executive with the right to participate in all of
our long-term compensation plans and employee benefit plans on a basis no less
favorable than our other senior executive officers.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Employment
Agreements provide Mr. Hanrahan and Ms. Harker with the right to receive certain
payments and to continue to receive certain benefits after the termination of
their employment. These events and the related payments and benefits are
described in &#147;Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control&#148;
beginning on page&nbsp;38 of this proxy statement.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Performance Incentive Plan<a name="PerformanceIncentivePlan_225539"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">In the first
quarter of 2007, we made cash payments to each of the named executive officers
under the Performance Incentive Plan for performance during 2006. The amount
paid to each executive is included in the amounts reported in the &#147;Non-Equity
Incentive Plan Compensation&#148; column of the Summary Compensation Table for such
executive and is identified in footnote&nbsp;5 to that table.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Performance
Incentive Plan provides annual cash incentives to key employees with
significant responsibility for achieving performance goals critical to our
success. The target cash incentive payment for each executive and the
performance goals for the payment are established on an annual basis. Each of
our named executive officers has a specific cash incentive target expressed as
a percentage of his or her annual base salary. The targets for our named
executive officers for 2006 ranged from 70 percent to 150 percent, depending on
the executive&#146;s specific job responsibilities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The actual cash
payments made under the Performance Incentive Plan are based upon the
realization of the performance goals established for the year and range from a
threshold of 50&nbsp;percent of the targeted cash payment to a maximum of 200
percent of that targeted cash payment. The threshold, target, and maximum cash
incentive payments for 2006 performance for each of our named executive
officers is contained in the &#147;Estimated Future Payouts Under Non-Equity
Incentive Plan&#148; columns in the Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">27</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='27',FILE='C:\fc\137182228618_D11624_2132815\6350-1-cl.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 17 18:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">After the end
of each year, the Compensation Committee determines the extent to which the
performance goals and any other material terms for such year have been achieved.
Payments are then made on the basis of the Compensation Committee&#146;s determination
(it being our intention to make such payments on or before March 15 of such
calendar year in order to qualify for the short-term deferral exception under Section&nbsp;409A
of the Code).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The
Compensation Committee determined that the performance goals for each of the
named executive officers for 2006 were satisfied and that each named executive
officer was entitled to receive the targeted amount for him or her under the
Performance Incentive Plan.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">2003 Long Term Compensation Plan<a name="a2003LongTermCompensationPlan_225542"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Summary
Compensation Table and Grants of Plan-Based Awards table include amounts
relating to Performance Units (PUs), Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), and Stock
Options (Options) granted under the LTC Plan.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Performance Units</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The amount
reported in the &#147;Non-Equity Plan Incentive Compensation&#148; column of the Summary
Compensation Table for each executive includes amounts paid in the first
quarter of 2007 for PUs awarded in 2004. The amount paid to each executive is
set forth in footnote&nbsp;5 to that table. The amounts paid were based on our
realization of the Cash Value Added required by the 2004 PU awards for the
three year period ended December&nbsp;31, 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Cash Value
Added is our subsidiary operating cash flow less a charge for capital used
during the three year period, as determined by the Compensation Committee at
the time a PU is granted. Adjustments to the Cash Value Added set forth in any
PU may be made based on changes to our portfolio, such as an asset divestiture
or sale of a portion of our equity interest in a subsidiary.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The PUs vest in
equal installments over a three year period. The payments made with respect to
PUs are based on the realization of the Cash Value Added set forth in the PU
award. If the Cash Value Added is less than 90% of the performance target, no
payment is made. If the Cash Value Added is 90 percent, each PU has a value of
$0.50. If the Cash Value Added is greater than 90 percent and less than 100
percent, and greater than 100 percent and less than 120% of the performance
target, the value of each PU is based upon straight-line interpolation, subject
to a maximum value of $2.00 per PU.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">During the
three year period ended December 31, 2006, the Cash Value Added exceeded the
target for Cash Value Added set forth in each executive&#146;s 2004 Performance
Units. As a result, the payment made to each executive was $1.1076 per unit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Summary
Compensation Table does not include any amounts payable in the future under
Performance Units awarded in years after 2004.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">28</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\fc\137182228618_D11624_2132815\6350-1-cl.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 17 18:23 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Restricted Stock Units</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The amount
reported in the &#147;Stock Awards&#148; column of the Summary Compensation Table for
each executive is based upon the dollar amount recognized for financial
statement reporting purposes for the year ended December 31, 2006 of Restricted
Stock Units (RSUs) held by the executive, including RSUs granted in prior
years.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Each RSU is
awarded pursuant to the terms of a Restricted Stock Unit Award Agreement and
represents the right to receive a single share of our common stock. Each RSU
award vests in equal installments on each anniversary of the award over a three
year period if (1) the executive continues to be employed by us on such date
and (2) either (A) our total stockholder return (&#147;TSR&#148;) exceeds the TSR of the
S&amp;P 500 Index for the three year vesting period, or (B) our TSR is positive,
the S&amp;P 500 Index is positive, and our TSR is within five percent of the
TSR of the S&amp;P 500 Index, in each case for the three year vesting period
(provided that the Compensation Committee does not exercise the discretion it
has in such circumstances to prevent the RSUs from vesting). Once RSUs are
vested, the executive must continue holding them for an additional two years
before they are paid out. The Compensation Committee has the discretion to
direct the payment of the RSUs to be paid in cash, based on the fair market
value of our shares on the delivery date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The grant date
fair value of the RSUs awarded in 2006 is included in the amounts reported
under the &#147;Grant Date Fair Value of Awards&#148; column of the Grants of Plan-Based
Awards Table.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Options</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The amount
reported in the &#147;Option Awards&#148; column of the Summary Compensation Table for
each executive is based upon the dollar amount recognized for financial
reporting purposes for the year ended December 31, 2006 of Options held by the
executive, including Options granted in prior years pursuant to our LTC Plan
and prior plans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Each Option is
awarded pursuant to the terms of an option agreement and represents the right
to purchase a share of our common stock at a fixed exercise price after the
Option vests. Each Option vests in equal installments on each anniversary of
the award over a three year period, provided the executive continues to be
employed by us on that date.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Effect of Termination of Employment or Change
in Control</font></i></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The vesting of
Performance Units, Restricted Stock Units, and Options and the ability of the
named executive officers to exercise or receive payments under those awards are
affected by a termination of their employment and by a change in control. These
events and the related payments and benefits are described in &#147;Potential
Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control&#148; beginning on page&nbsp;38 of
this proxy statement.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:18.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">29</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\fc\137182228618_D11624_2132815\6350-1-cl.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 17 18:23 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Outstanding Equity Awards at Fiscal Year-End
(2006)<a name="OutstandingEquityAwardsAtFiscalYe_210858"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The following table contains information
concerning all unexercised options and stock awards granted to the named
executive officers which have not vested and which were outstanding on December&nbsp;31,
2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 5.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Closing price on the last day of the
fiscal year (December&nbsp;29, 2006) was $22.04.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">30</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;font-weight:normal;">NOTES:</font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Mr. Hanrahan was granted 168,666 options
on February 4, 2004, which vest ratably over three years. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, 56,222 were unvested. All remaining 56,222 options vested on February 4,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Mr. Hanrahan was granted 97,997 options on
February 25, 2005, which vest ratably over three years. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, 65,331 were unvested of which 32,665 vested on February 25, 2007 and
32,666 will vest on February&nbsp;25, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Mr. Hanrahan was granted 152,672 options
on February 24, 2006, which vest ratably over three years. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, all 152,672 options were unvested of which 50,891 vested on February 24,
2007, 50,890 will vest on February&nbsp;24, 2008, and 50,891 will vest on February&nbsp;24,
2009.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Ms. Harker was granted 23,340 options on January
23, 2006, which vest ratably over three years. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006,
all 23,340 options were unvested of which 7,780 vested on January 23, 2007,
7,780 will vest on January&nbsp;23, 2008, and 7,780 will vest on January&nbsp;23,
2009.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Mr. Luraschi was granted 56,222 options on
February 4, 2004, which vest ratably over three years. As of December 31, 2006,
18,741 were unvested. All remaining 18,741 options vested on February&nbsp;4,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;(6)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi was granted 32,666
options on February 25, 2005, which vest ratably over three years. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, 21,777 were unvested of which 10,888 vested on February 25, 2007 and
10,889 will vest on February 25, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;(7)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Mr. Luraschi was granted 47,710 options on
February 24, 2006, which vest ratably over three years. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, all 47,710 options were unvested of which 15,904 vested on February 24,
2007, 15,903 will vest on February 24, 2008, and 15,903 will vest on February 24,
2009.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;(8)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Mr. Gluski was
granted 22,489 options on February 4, 2004, which vest ratably over three
years. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, 7,496 were unvested. All remaining 7,496
options vested on February&nbsp;4, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&nbsp;&nbsp;(9)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Gluski was granted 13,066 options on February 25, 2005, which vest ratably over
three years. As of December 31, 2006, 8,710 were unvested of which 4,355 vested
on February 25, 2007 and 4,355 will vest on February&nbsp;25, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(10)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Gluski was granted 40,553 options on February 24, 2006, which vest ratably over
three years. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, all 40,553 options were unvested of
which 13,518 vested on February 24, 2007, 13,517 will vest on February&nbsp;24,
2008, and 13,518 will vest on February&nbsp;24, 2009.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(11)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Jaisinghani was granted 19,490 options on February 4, 2004, which vest ratably
over three years. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, 6,497 were unvested. All
remaining 6,497 options vested on February&nbsp;4, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(12)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Jaisinghani was granted 11,868 options on February 25, 2005, which vest ratably
over three years. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, 7,912 were unvested of which
3,956 vested on February 25, 2007 and 3,956 will vest on February&nbsp;25,
2008.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(13)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Jaisinghani was granted 41,349 options on February 24, 2006, which vest ratably
over three years. As of December 31, 2006, all 41,349 options were unvested of
which 13,783 vested on February 24, 2007, 13,783 will vest on February&nbsp;24,
2008, and 13,783 will vest on February&nbsp;24, 2009.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(14)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Sharp was granted 68, 403 options on February 4, 2004, which vest ratably over
three years. As of December 31, 2006, 22,801 were unvested. All remaining
22,801 option vested on February&nbsp;4, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(15)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Sharp was granted 41,376 options on February 25, 2005, which vest ratably over
three years. As of December 31, 2006, 27,584 were unvested of which 13,792
vested on February 25, 2007 and 13,792 will vest on February&nbsp;25, 2008.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(16)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Hanrahan was granted 137,960 RSUs on February&nbsp;4, 2004. The RSUs vest based
on two conditions. The first is based on our total stockholder return for the
three-year period ending December 31, 2006. Assuming the first condition is
met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from
grant. On December 31, 2006, the performance condition was achieved and Mr. Hanrahan
vested in the two-thirds of the award (91,973) for which he had achieved the
service-based vesting criteria. The remaining one-third of the award (45,987)
that remained unvested at December 31, 2006 became vested on February&nbsp;4,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(17)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; The
number of shares reported in this column for Mr. Luraschi is from two separate
grants.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.5pt 20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">Mr. Luraschi
was granted 59,079 RSUs on May 4, 2005 in connection with his promotion to
Executive Vice President for Business Development and Strategy. The grant vests
ratably over three years. As of December&nbsp;31, 2006, 39,386 RSUs were unvested
of which 19,693 will vest on May 4, 2007 and 19,693 will vest on May 4, 2008. Mr.
Luraschi was granted 45,987 RSUs on February 4, 2004. The RSUs vest based on
two conditions. The first is based on our total stockholder return for the
three-year period ending December&nbsp;31, 2006. Assuming the first condition
is met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year
from grant. On December 31, 2006, the performance condition was achieved and Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi
vested in the two-thirds of the award (30,658) for which he had achieved the
service-based vesting criteria. The remaining one-third of the award (15,329)
that remained unvested at December 31, 2006 became vested on February&nbsp;4,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(18)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Gluski was granted 18,395 RSUs on February 4, 2004. The RSUs vest based on two
conditions. The first is based on our total stockholder return for the
three-year period ending December 31, 2006. Assuming the first condition is
met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from
grant. On December 31, 2006, the performance condition was achieved and Mr. Gluski
vested in the two-thirds of the award (12,263) for which he had achieved the
service-based vesting criteria. The remaining one-third of the award (6,132)
that remained unvested at December 31, 2006 became vested on February 4, 2007.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">31</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='31',FILE='C:\fc\137182327172_D11624_2132815\6350-1-cn.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 17 18:25 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(19)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Jaisinghani was granted 15,942 RSUs on February 4, 2004. The RSUs vest based on
two conditions. The first is based on our total return to shareholders for the
three-year period ending December 31, 2006. Assuming the first condition is
met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from
grant. On December 31, 2006, the performance condition was achieved and Mr. Jaisinghani
vested in the two-thirds of the award (10,628) for which he had achieved the
service-based vesting criteria. The remaining one-third of the award (5,314)
that remained unvested at December 31, 2006 became vested on February&nbsp;4,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(20)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Sharp was granted 55,950 RSUs on February&nbsp;4, 2004. The RSUs vest based on
two conditions. The first is based on the Company&#146;s total stockholder return
for the three-year period ending December 31, 2006. Assuming the first
condition is met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments beginning
one year from grant. On December 31, 2006, the performance condition was
achieved and Mr. Sharp vested in two-thirds of the award (37,300) for which he
had achieved the service-based vesting criteria. The remaining one-third of the
award (18,650) that remained unvested at December 31, 2006 became vested on February&nbsp;4,
2007.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(21)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Hanrahan was granted 73,616 RSUs on February 25, 2005 and 75,085 RSUs on February
24, 2006. For both awards, the RSUs vest based on two conditions. The first is
based on our total stockholder return for the three-year period beginning January&nbsp;1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:4.5pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">st</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160;in the year the
RSUs are granted. Assuming the first condition is met, the RSUs vest in three
equal annual installments beginning one year from grant. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, the entire amount of both the February 25, 2005 grant and the February 24,
2006 grant are unvested and therefore are included in this column.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(22)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Ms.
Harker was granted 17,558 RSUs on January 23, 2006. The RSUs vest based on two
conditions. The first is based on our total stockholder return for the
three-year period beginning January 1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:4.5pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">st</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160;in the year the RSUs are granted. Assuming the
first condition is met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments
beginning one year from grant. As of December 31, 2006, the entire amount of
the January 23, 2006 grant is unvested and therefore is included in this column.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(23)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Luraschi was granted 24,539 RSUs on February&nbsp;25, 2005 and 23,464 RSUs on February
24, 2006. For both awards, the RSUs vest based on two conditions. The first is
based on our total stockholder return for the three-year period beginning January
1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:4.5pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">st</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160;in
the year the RSUs are granted. Assuming the first condition is met, the RSUs
vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from grant. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, the entire amount of both the February 25, 2005 grant and the February 24,
2006 grant are unvested and therefore are included in this column.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(24)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Gluski was granted 9,815 RSUs on February 25, 2005 and 19,944 RSUs on February 24,
2006. For both awards, the RSUs vest based on two conditions. The first is
based on our total stockholder return for the three-year period beginning January
1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:4.5pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">st</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160;in
the year the RSUs are granted. Assuming the first condition is met, the RSUs
vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from grant. As of December
31, 2006, the entire amount of both the February 25, 2005 grant and the February
24, 2006 grant are unvested and therefore are included in this column.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(25)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Jaisinghani was granted 8,916 RSUs on February 25, 2005 and 20,336 RSUs on February
24, 2006. For both awards, the RSUs vest based on two conditions. The first is
based on our total stockholder return for the three-year period beginning January
1</font><font size="1" style="font-size:4.5pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">st</font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160;in
the year the RSUs are granted. Assuming the first condition is met, the RSUs
vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from grant. As of December&nbsp;31,
2006, the entire amount of both the February 25, 2005 grant and the February 24,
2006 grant are unvested and therefore are included in this column.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 4.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:7.0pt;">(26)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><font size="1" style="font-size:7.0pt;">&#160; Mr.
Sharp was granted 31,083 RSUs on February 25, 2005. For this award, the RSUs
vest based on two conditions. The first is based on the Company&#146;s total
stockholder return for the three-year period beginning January 1 in the year
the RSUs are granted. Assuming the first condition is met, the RSUs vest in
three equal annual installments beginning one year from grant. As of December 31,
2006, the entire amount of the February 25, 2005 grant are unvested and
therefore are included in this column.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Option Exercises and Stock Vested (2006)<a name="OptionExercisesAndStockVested2006_065526"></a></font></b></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="27" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="37" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:27.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">37,300 </font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="27" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:20.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(5)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.8pt;">

  <td width="59" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:44.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">$&nbsp;822,092</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.75pt;">

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">NOTES:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan
was granted 137,960 RSUs on February 4, 2004. The RSUs vest based on two
conditions. The first is based on our total stockholder return for the
three-year period ending December 31, 2006. Assuming the first condition is
met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from
grant. On December 31, 2006, the performance condition was achieved and Mr. Hanrahan
vested in the two-thirds of the award (91,973) for which he had achieved the
service-based vesting criteria.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>The
number of shares reported in this column is from two separate grants.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi
was granted 59,079 RSUs on May 4, 2005 in connection with his promotion to
Executive Vice President for Business Development and Strategy. The grant vests
ratably over three years. On May 4, 2006, 19,693 RSUs vested.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi was granted 45,987 RSUs on February
4, 2004. The RSUs vest based on two conditions. The first is based on our total
stockholder return for the three-year period ending December 31, 2006. Assuming
the first condition is met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments
beginning one year from grant. On December 31, 2006, the performance condition
was achieved and Mr. Luraschi vested in the two-thirds of the award (30,658)
for which he had achieved the service-based vesting criteria.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.
Gluski was granted 18,395 RSUs on February 4, 2004. The RSUs vest based on two
conditions. The first is based on our total shareholder return for the
three-year period ending December 31, 2006. Assuming the first condition is
met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from
grant. On December 31, 2006, the performance condition was achieved and Mr. Gluski
vested in the two-thirds of the award (12,263) for which he had achieved the
service-based vesting criteria.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr.
Jaisinghani was granted 15,942 RSUs on February 4, 2004. The RSUs vest based on
two conditions. The first is based on our total shareholder return for the
three-year period ending December 31, 2006. Assuming the first condition is
met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from
grant. On December 31, 2006, the performance condition was achieved and Mr. Jaisinghani
vested in the two-thirds of the award (10,628) for which he had achieved the
service-based vesting criteria.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">33</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Mr. Sharp was granted
55,950 RSUs on February 4, 2004. The RSUs vest based on two conditions. The
first is based on our total shareholder return for the three-year period ending
December 31, 2006. Assuing the first condition is met, the RSUs vest in three
equal annual installments beginning one year from grant. On December 31, 2006,
the performance condition was achieved and Mr. Sharp vested in two-thirds of
the award (37,300) for which he had achieved the service-based vesting
criteria.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Nonqualified Deferred Compensation<a name="NonqualifiedDeferredCompensation_065559"></a></font></b></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">NOTES:</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts
in this column represent contributions to the Restoration Supplemental
Retirement Plan and the mandatory deferral of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs)
that became vested on December 31, 2006. The RSUs vested based on two
conditions. The first was based on our total stockholder return for the
three-year period ending December 31, 2006. Assuming the first condition is
met, the RSUs vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from
grant. As of December 31, 2006, the total stockholder return condition was
satisfied and two-thirds of the RSU grant became fully vested. The following is
a breakdown of amounts reported in this column:</p>

<div align="center">

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="8" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:6.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="44" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:33.15pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="59" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:44.25pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">$&nbsp;822,092</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="44" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:33.2pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(2)</font><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font></b>Amounts
in this column represent our contributions to the Restoration Supplemental
Retirement Plan. The amount reported in this column and our additional
contributions to the 401K Plan are included in the amounts reported in the &#147;All
Other Compensation&#148; column of the Summary Compensation Table.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">34</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='34',FILE='C:\Fc\14185614455_P66507CHE_2137302\6350-1-cp.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 08:56 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

in this column represent investment earnings under the Restoration Supplemental
Retirement Plan and, for Mr. Hanrahan, Mr. Luraschi, and Mr. Jaisinghani,
investment earnings under our Supplemental Retirement Plan. A breakdown of
amounts reported in this column is as follows:</p>

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Amounts
in this column represent the balance of amounts in the Restoration Supplemental
Retirement Plan, the Supplemental Retirement Plan and the mandatory deferral of
RSUs. A breakdown of amounts reported in this column is as follows:</p>
