<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">57</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='57',FILE='C:\fc\14113431876_D11624_2138237\6350-1-de.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 13:44 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<div align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="left" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">*</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Shares
held represent less than 1% of the total number of outstanding shares of common
stock of the Company.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(1)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Shares
of common stock subject to options, units or other securities that are
exercisable or convertible into shares of our common stock within 60 days of
February 23, 2007 are deemed to be outstanding and beneficially owned by the
person holding such options, units or other securities. However, such shares of
common stock are not deemed to be outstanding for the purpose of computing the
percentage ownership of any other person.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(2)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
(a) the following shares issuable upon exercise of options outstanding as of
February 23, 2007 that are able to be exercised on or before April 24, 2007: Mr.&nbsp;Darman&nbsp;&#150;
432,760 shares; Dr. Johnson &#150; 0; Mr. Koskinen &#150; 0; Mr. Hanrahan &#150; 1,418,378
shares; Mr.&nbsp;Lader &#150; 39,626 shares; Mr.&nbsp;McArthur &#150; 17,340 shares; Dr. Moose
&#150; 1,219; Mr. Odeen &#150; 11,204 shares; Mr.&nbsp;Rossotti &#150; 21,912 shares; Mr. Sandstrom
&#150; 52,815 shares; Mr. Luraschi &#150; 242,121 shares, Ms.&nbsp;Harker &#150; 7,780 shares;
Mr. Gluski &#150; 87,557 shares; Mr. Jaisinghani &#150; 39,534 shares; and Mr. Sharp &#150; 198,699
shares; all Directors and executive officers as a group &#150; 2,915,548 shares; (b)
the following units issuable under the Deferred Compensation Plan for
Directors: Mr. Darman &#150; 94,203 units; Dr.&nbsp;Johnson &#150; 31,234 units; Mr. Koskinen
&#150; 39,984 units; Mr. Lader &#150; 34,431 units; Mr. McArthur &#150; 39,267 units; Dr. Moose
&#150; 22,756 units; Mr. Odeen &#150; 24,009 units; Mr. Rossotti &#150; 38,721 units; and Mr. Sandstrom
&#150; 37,681 units; all Directors as a group 362,286 units; (c) the following
shares held in The AES Retirement Savings Plan and the Employee Stock Ownership
Plan: Mr. Hanrahan &#150; 44,036 shares; Mr. Luraschi &#150; 47,012 shares; Ms. Harker &#150; 1.075
shares; Mr. Gluski &#150; 2,215 shares; Mr. Jaisinghani &#150; 25,353 shares; and Mr.
Sharp &#150; 57, 453 shares; all executive officers as a group 606,023 shares; and (d)
the following units issuable under the Restoration Supplemental Retirement Plan
and the AES Corporation Supplemental Retirement Plan: Mr. Hanrahan &#150; 52,270; Mr.&nbsp;Luraschi
15,634 units; Ms. Harker &#150; 1,276 units; Mr. Gluski &#150; 3,003 units;Mr. Jaisinghani
&#150; 5,328 units; and Mr. Sharp &#150; 19,475 units; all executive officers as a group
&#150; 121,689 units; (e) the following fully vested RSUS issuable under the 2003
long-term compensation plan: Mr. Hanrahan &#150; 137,960; Mr. Luraschi &#150; 65,680; Ms.
Harker &#150; 0; Mr. Gluski &#150; 18,395; Mr. Jaisinghani &#150; 15,942; Mr. Sharp &#150; 55,950;
all executive officers as a group &#150; 394,563.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(3)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
160,000 shares held in a sub-chapter S corporation of which Mr.&nbsp;Darman has
beneficial interest; also includes 17,000 shares held in a trust.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(4)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
110 shares held by Mr.&nbsp;Hanrahan&#146;s wife and 5,500 underlying shares of
convertible securities.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(5)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
7,086 shares owned jointly by Mr. Lader and his wife, 25 shares held by his
daughter, 89,380 shares held in a family-established private foundation,
of which Mr. Lader disclaims beneficial ownership, and 5,160 shares in an IRA
for the benefit of Mr. Lader.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(6)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
15,000 shares held jointly by Mr.&nbsp;Odeen and his wife.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(7)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
40,000 shares held jointly by Mr.&nbsp;Rossotti and his wife.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(8)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
232 shares owned by Mr.&nbsp;Jaisinghani&#146;s spouse and 14,297 shares
beneficially owned by Mr.&nbsp;Jaisinghani&#146;s spouse pursuant to The AES
Retirement Savings Plan;&#160; Mr. Jaisinghani
disclaims beneficial ownership of the aforementioned shares.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(9)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Includes
880 shares held in a UGMA account for Mr. Sharp&#146;s daughter.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">(10)</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160; </font>Of
this aggregate number, Legg Mason Funds Management, Inc. reported on SEC
Schedule 13G filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission dated February 15,
2007, that it had (a) sole voting power on no shares, (b) shared voting power
on 119,019,275 shares, (c) sole dispositive power on no shares, and (d)&nbsp;shared
dispositive power on 119,019,275 shares.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 2.5pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(11) Of this aggregate number, FMR Corporation reported on SEC Schedule
13G filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission dated February 14, 2007,
that it had (a) sole voting power on 7,949,532 shares, (b)&nbsp;shared voting
power on no shares, (c) sole dispositive power on 66,367,539 shares and (d) shared
dispositive power on no shares.</p>


 <p style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:6.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">58</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='58',FILE='C:\fc\14113431876_D11624_2138237\6350-1-de.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 21 13:44 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" style="background:#EBEBEB;border-collapse:collapse;font-family:Times New Roman;width:100.0%;">
 <tr style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="100%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:100.0%;">
  <p align="center" style="font-size:9.5pt;margin:3.0pt 0pt;text-align:center;"><!-- SET mrlHTMLTableFull --><!-- SET mrlNoTableShading --><font size="3" style="font-size:12.0pt;">GOVERNANCE MATTERS<a name="GovernanceMatters_040519"></a></font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.2pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Stockholder Proposals and Nominations for Director<a name="StockholderProposalsAndNomination_050808"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.2pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">If any stockholder intends to present a
proposal to be considered for inclusion in the Company&#146;s proxy material for the
2008 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, the proposal must comply with the
requirements of Rule 14a-8 of Regulation 14A of the Exchange Act and must
be submitted in writing by notice delivered or mailed by first-class
United States mail, postage prepaid to the Secretary, The AES Corporation, 4300
Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, Virginia 22203. Any such proposal must be received
no later than January&nbsp;24, 2008. Any such notice must set forth: (a) the
name and address of the stockholder and the text of the proposal to be
introduced; (b) the number of shares of common stock held of record, owned
beneficially and represented by proxy by such Stockholder as of the date of
such notice; and (c)&nbsp;a representation that the stockholder intends to
appear in person or by proxy at the&#160; 2008
Annual Meeting of Stockholders to introduce the proposal specified in the
notice.</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:9.5pt;line-height:11.2pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">In addition, our By-laws establish certain
requirements for proposals a stockholder wishes to make from the floor of the
2008 Annual Meeting of Stockholders. If the proposal is for a matter other than
the nomination of a director for election at the meeting, the proposal must be
written and delivered to the Secretary at the address set forth above no
earlier than the close of business on the 90</font><font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">th</font>&#160;day prior to the meeting, and not later than
the close of business not less than 60 days nor more than 90 days prior to the
first anniversary of the preceding year&#146;s annual meeting provided, however,
that in the event that the date of the annual meeting is more than 30 days &#160;before or more than 60 days after such
anniversary date, notice by the stockholder to be timely must be so delivered
by not earlier than the close of business on the 90<font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">th</font>&#160;day prior to such annual meeting and not later
than the close of business on the later of the 60<font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">th</font>&#160;day prior to such annual meeting or the 10<font size="1" style="font-size:6.0pt;position:relative;top:-2.0pt;">th</font>&#160;day following the day on which public
announcement of the date of such meeting is first made by the Company. The
notice must contain (a)&nbsp;a brief description of the business desired to be
brought before the meeting, the reasons for conducting such business at the
meeting and any material interest the stockholder (or any beneficial owner on
whose behalf the proposal is made) has in such business, (b) the name and
address of such stockholder (and such beneficial owner), and (c)&nbsp;the class
and number of shares of stock held by such stockholder (and such beneficial
owner).</p>

<p style="line-height:11.2pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The chairperson of the 2008 Annual Meeting of
Stockholders may refuse to acknowledge the introduction of any stockholder
proposal not made in compliance with the foregoing procedures.</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.2pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Our By-laws also contain a procedure for a
stockholder&#146;s nomination of directors from the floor of the 2008 Annual Meeting
of Stockholders. Any record owner of common stock entitled to be voted
generally in the election of directors may nominate one or more persons for
election as a director at a stockholders meeting. Written notice must be given
to the Secretary of AES at the address set forth above describing the intention
to make such a nomination. The notice must be given, with respect to an Annual
Meeting, no later than 90 days in advance of such Annual Meeting and with
respect to a special meeting, no later than the close of business on the
seventh day following the earlier of (a) the date on which notice of such
special meeting is first given to stockholders and (b) the date on which a
public announcement of such meeting is first made. Each notice must include (i)
the name and address of each stockholder who intends to appear in person or by
proxy to make the nomination, and of the person or persons to be nominated; (ii)
a description of all arrangements or understandings between the stockholder and
each nominee and any other person or persons (naming them) pursuant to which
the nomination is to be made by the stockholder; (iii) such other information
regarding each nominee proposed by such stockholder as would have been required
to be included in a proxy statement filed pursuant to Rule 14a-8 of
Regulation 14A of the Exchange Act; and (iv) the consent of each nominee to
serve if </font></p>


 <p style="margin:15.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">59</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='59',FILE='C:\fc\144154647948_D11854_2147334\6350-1-dg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 24 15:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="line-height:11.2pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">elected. The presiding officer of the meeting
may refuse to acknowledge the nomination of any person not made in compliance with
the above described procedures.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">AES Code of Business Conduct and Ethics and
Corporate Governance Guidelines<a name="AesCodeOfBusinessConductAndEthics_050812"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">A Code of
Business Conduct and Ethics (&#147;Ethics Code&#148;) and Corporate Governance Guidelines
have been adopted by the Board. The Ethics Code is intended to govern as a
requirement of employment the actions of everyone who works at AES, including
employees of AES subsidiaries and affiliates. The Ethics Code and the Corporate
Governance Guidelines can be located in their entirety on the Company&#146;s web
site (www.aes.com). Any person may obtain a copy of the Ethics Code or the
Corporate Governance Guidelines without charge by making a written request to: Office
of the Corporate Secretary, The AES Corporation, 4300 Wilson Boulevard,
Arlington, VA 22203. If any amendments to or waivers from the Ethics Code or
the Corporate Governance Guidelines are made, we will disclose such amendments
or waivers on our website.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;Beneficial Ownership
Reporting Compliance<a name="Section16abeneficialOwnershipRepo_050815"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Based solely on
the Company&#146;s review of reports filed under Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act
and certain written representations (as allowed by Item 405(b)(2)(i)&nbsp;of
Regulation S-K), the Company believes that no person subject to Section 16(a) of
the Exchange Act with respect to the registrant failed to file on a timely
basis the reports required by Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act during the most
recent fiscal year, except for Ms.&nbsp;Freeman, who in April 2006 signed the
Annual Report on 10K as the Company&#146;s Chief Accounting Officer and therefore
became an Affiliate of the Company but at that time did not file a Form 3. Ms. Freeman
has subsequently filed a Form&nbsp;3.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Charitable Contributions<a name="CharitableContributions_050817"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Under NYSE
303A.02 (b) (v), the Company is required to report as to whether or not any
charitable contributions were made by the Company to any charitable
organization for which an AES Director served as an executive officer of that
organization in an amount greater than $1 million or 2% of such charitable
organization&#146;s consolidated gross revenues for year 2006, 2005 or 2004. The
Company did not make any such charitable contributions in excess of those
amounts.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Communications with the Board or Its
Committees<a name="CommunicationsWithTheBoardOrItsCo_050818"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Board
offers several e-mail addresses as set forth below for Stockholders and
interested parties to send communications through the Office of the Corporate Secretary
of the Company to the non-management Directors and/or the five standing
committees of the Board:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">AES Board of
Directors: <u>AESDirectors@aes.com</u></font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Compensation
Committee:<br>
<u>CompCommitteeChair@aes.com</u></font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Environment,
Safety and Technology Committee:<br>
<u>ESTCommitteeChair@aes.com</u></font></p>

<p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Financial Audit
Committee:<br>
<u>AuditCommitteeChair@aes.com</u></font></p>


 <p style="margin:15.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">60</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='60',FILE='C:\fc\144154647948_D11854_2147334\6350-1-dg.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 24 15:47 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="line-height:11.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Nominating and
Corporate Governance Committee:<br>
<u>NomGovCommitteeChair@aes.com</u></font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">The Corporate Secretary
will forward to the Directors all communications that, in his or her judgment,
are appropriate for consideration by the Directors. Examples of communications
that would not be considered as appropriate for consideration by the Directors
include commercial solicitations, requests for employment and matters not
relevant to the Stockholders, to the functioning of the Board or to the affairs
of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Form&nbsp;10-K Annual Report<a name="Form10kAnnualReport_050827"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Any Stockholder who desires an additional
copy of the Company&#146;s 2006 Annual Report on Form 10-K filed on or about May&nbsp;23,
2007 with the Securities and Exchange Commission may obtain a copy (excluding
exhibits) without charge by addressing a request to the Office of the Corporate
Secretary, The AES Corporation, 4300 Wilson Boulevard, Arlington, Virginia
22203. Exhibits also may be requested, but a charge equal to the reproduction
cost thereof will be made. Stockholders may also obtain a copy by visiting the
Company&#146;s web site at http://www.aes.com.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">By Order of the
Board of Directors,</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">Brian A. Miller<br>
Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary</font></p>


 <p style="margin:15.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">61</font></p>

22203):<a name="DirectionsToAnnualMeeting4300Wils_050151"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="background:#EBEBEB;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">From Points North</font></b>&nbsp;<font style="font-weight:normal;">&#151; I-270 SPUR S toward I-495 S/Northern Virginia; merge onto
Capital Beltway/I-495 S; Merge onto VA-267 E via Exit 45B on the
LEFT toward I-66 E/Washington; VA-267 E becomes I-66E; take
the Fairfax Drive exit (Exit 71). Turn RIGHT onto Glebe Road; turn LEFT onto
Wilson Boulevard. The AES offices are located in the building on RIGHT after
turning onto Wilson Boulevard.</font></p>

<p style="background:#EBEBEB;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">From Points South</font></b><font style="font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;&#151; </font><font style="font-weight:normal;">I-95
N to I-395 N toward Washington; Merge onto S Glebe Road/VA-120 N
via Exit 7B toward Marymount University; turn RIGHT onto Wilson Boulevard; End
at the AES offices located at 4300 Wilson Boulevard.</font></p>

<p style="background:#EBEBEB;font-size:9.5pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:9.5pt;">From Points West</font></b><font style="font-weight:normal;">&nbsp;&#151; </font><font style="font-weight:normal;">I-66
E toward Washington, DC; take Fairfax Drive exit (Exit 71); turn RIGHT onto
Glebe Road; turn LEFT onto Wilson Boulevard. The AES offices are located in the
building on RIGHT after turning onto Wilson Boulevard.</font></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="160" noshade color="black" align="center" style="width:120.0pt;"></div>

is important. Please vote immediately.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">This proxy when properly executed will be
voted in the manner directed herein.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">If no direction is made, this proxy will be
voted FOR Proposals 1 and 2.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center"></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">The Board
of Directors recommends a vote FOR Company Proposals 1 and 2.</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">trustee or guardian, please
  give full title as such. </font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="9%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.46%;">
  <p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;font-weight:bold;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\fc\13815197994_D11854_2135395\6350-2-ma.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='May 18 15:19 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">TELEPHONE AND INTERNET VOTING INSTRUCTIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">You may use the telephone
or the Internet, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, to vote. However, to ensure
that your vote will be counted, please cast your Internet or telephone vote
before midnight on June&nbsp;24, 2007. To access the telephone or Internet
voting instruction system, you must use the control number printed in the shaded
box on the reverse side.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">To vote over the telephone:</font></b><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;"> Using a touch-tone telephone, call </font><b><font size="2" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1-800-652-VOTE (8683) within the
United States, Canada and Puerto Rico</font></b><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">.</font></p>

<p style="color:black;font-family:Times New Roman;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-autospace:none;text-indent:-36.0pt;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font><b><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">To vote over the Internet:</font></b><font size="2" color="black" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;"> Log on to the Internet and go to http://www.investorvote.com</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">Using
the telephone or Internet voting instruction system has the same effect as
giving voting instructions by marking, signing, dating and returning your paper
Proxy Card. If you use the telephone or Internet voting instruction system,
there is no need for you to mail back your Proxy.</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">DETACH HERE</font></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PROXY</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">THE AES
CORPORATION</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Proxy
Solicited on Behalf of the Board of Directors of <br>
The AES Corporation for Annual Meeting June&nbsp;25, 2007.</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Undersigned hereby
appoints Richard Darman or Paul T. Hanrahan, or either of them, and any
substitute or substitutes, to be the attorneys and proxies of the undersigned
at the Annual Meeting of Stockholders of The AES Corporation (&#147;AES&#148;) to be held
at 9:30&nbsp;a.m. EDT on Monday, June&nbsp;25, 2007 at 4300 Wilson Boulevard,
Arlington, VA 22203, or at any adjournment thereof, and to vote at such meeting
the shares of Common Stock of AES the undersigned held of record on the books
of AES on the record date for the meeting for the election for the Nominees
listed below (Proposal 1) and the ratification of the appointment of
Independent Auditor (Proposal 2) referred to on the reverse side of this card
and described in the Proxy Statement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Election of Directors,
Nominees:</font></p>

<p style="color:black;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" color="black" face="Times New Roman" style="color:windowtext;font-size:10.0pt;">(01)
Richard Darman, (02) Paul Hanrahan, (03) Kristina M. Johnson,<br>
(04) John A. Koskinen, (05) Philip Lader, (06) John H. McArthur,<br>
(07) Sandra O. Moose, (08) Philip A. Odeen, (09)&nbsp;Charles O. Rossotti, and<br>
(10)&nbsp;Sven Sandstrom</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">You are
encouraged to specify your choices by marking the appropriate boxes on the
REVERSE SIDE of this Proxy Card but you need not mark any boxes if you wish to
vote in accordance with the Board of Directors&#146; recommendations. The proxies
cannot vote your share unless you sign and return this card, or vote by
telephone or the Internet.</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center"></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">PLEASE VOTE,
DATE AND SIGN THIS PROXY ON THE REVERSE SIDE OF THIS PROXY CARD AND RETURN
PROMPTLY IN THE <br>
ENCLOSED ENVELOPE.</font></b></p>

<div style="line-height:9.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><hr size="1" width="100%" noshade color="black" align="center"></div>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
